title: Virgin slashes 50 per cent off flights for kids within Australia and New Zealand
text:
Virgin Australia have launched their biggest ever sale on kids' tickets, with half price fares on offer for every child aged between two and 11.

The tickets are available for destinations within Australia and New Zealand, across all travel classes.

The offer is available until Wednesday. It will apply to flights between February 5 and March 25 next year, as well as May 1 and May 31 when kids travel with an adult.

A Virgin spokesperson said that the sale is in anticipation of 2020 being the year of family travel.

Virgin Australia are offering half price fares for every child aged between two and 11 who travels with an adult within Australia and New Zealand

'We're making it easy and affordable for all families to explore new destinations and take adventures together,' the airline said in a statement.

'Travel doesn't have to break the bank and these half-price kids' fares mean that going on a family holiday is now one step closer.'

The announcement comes less than two months after Virgin Australia cut 750 jobs following a $315million loss after tax this year.

The country's second-largest airline reported an underlying pre-tax loss of $71.2million for the year ending June 30.

The CEO blamed weak demand, higher fuel costs and a weaker currency.

The company has now lost money for seven years in a row, with total losses at $1.9billion.

The company is also planning a review all of its flight routes and is expected to make changes to increase efficiency.
description: Virgin Australia have launched their biggest ever sale on kids' tickets, with half price fares on offer for every child aged between two and 11.
authors: Alana Mazzoni For Daily Mail Australia
